annotation.spannedText: You should consider getting vaccinated against rabies if: you're travelling to an area where rabies is common and you plan to stay for a month or more or there's unlikely to be quick access to appropriate medical care you're travelling to an area where rabies is common and you plan to do activities that could put you at increased risk of exposure to animals with rabies, such as running or cycling

classMention.mentionClass: You should consider getting vaccinated against rabies if: you're travelling to an area where rabies is common and you plan to stay for a month or more or there's unlikely to be quick access to appropriate medical care you're travelling to an area where rabies is common and you plan to do activities that could put you at increased risk of exposure to animals with rabies, such as running or cycling

annotation.spannedText: It takes three to four weeks to complete the vaccine course, so you ideally need to start it at least a month before you plan to leave

classMention.mentionClass: It takes three to four weeks to complete the vaccine course, so you ideally need to start it at least a month before you plan to leave

annotation.spannedText: You'll need three doses of the vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: You'll need three doses of the vaccine

annotation.spannedText: If you're planning to travel to an area where rabies is found, you should complete the full course of three doses before your departure

classMention.mentionClass: If you're planning to travel to an area where rabies is found, you should complete the full course of three doses before your departure

annotation.spannedText: The vaccines used in the UK contain dead (inactive) rabies virus, so you can't catch rabies by being vaccinated

classMention.mentionClass: The vaccines used in the UK contain dead (inactive) rabies virus, so you can't catch rabies by being vaccinated
